column4: Can someone help me fix the low resolution Plymouth boot screen with my ATI Mobility Radeon driver?
you'll have to get into the grub settings for that... i'm not sure if you wanna be touching that
are there any other ways to fix it? i wouldnt think going grub would do anything
you sure? hang on a sec and i'll give you the instructions for the fix
1) open terminal and gksudo gedit /etc/default/grub in it you will find a line #GRUB_GFXMODE=640Ã—480.. uncomment it and change it to your native resolution.. save and close
will that also fix the part of plymouth only showing up for like two seconds?
2) gksudo gedit /etc/grub.d/00_header find the part that says gfxmode=${GRUB_GFXMODE} i think it's line 103 and under that line add a new line that says set gfxpayload=keep   save and close
3) in terminal paste sudo update-grub
that should fix it.. plymuth isn't working in native resolution when running on nvidia drivers so some crazy serb posted up the instructions... i just followed them and it worked :)
didn't really get into the internals to know what does what
thanks
np and good luck
